intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. communis, commonly known as cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact head of dark green leaves that form a rounded structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and produces small white or purple flowers in the spring. Its leaves are rich in nutrients such as vitamin C, fiber, and various minerals. This variety is widely cultivated for its edible leaves and is a staple in many cuisines around the world.
